comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; zh-CN; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061208 Firefox/2.0.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; zh-CN; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061208 Firefox/2.0.0.1

When I use FireFox 2.0.0.2 and 2.0.0.3RC, my scim has problem, the FireFox call an added scim-launcher. Thus system has two scim-launcher, I can see no select words list display. So I can't input Chinese normal. And FireFox 2.0.0.1 is good.

When FireFox 2.0.0.2 run, the ps result is like this:
opentiss@opentissx60:~/Documents/mozilla> ps xf | grep scim
 4314 ?        Ss     0:00 /usr/lib/scim-1.0/scim-helper-manager
 4312 ?        Ssl    0:09 /opt/kde3/bin/skim --np skimplugin_scim --display :0.0 -c socket -d --no-stay
 5417 pts/1    S+     0:00  |   |   \_ grep scim
 4227 ?        Ss     0:03 /usr/lib/scim-1.0/scim-launcher -d -c socket -e socket -f x11
 4209 ?        Ss     0:18 /usr/lib/scim-1.0/scim-launcher -d -c kconfig -e all -f socket --no-stay

You can see, 4227 is called by FireFox 2.0.0.2. And normal is 4209. Now two scim-launcher running, so bad thing happen.

My system is SLED 10, and skim 1.4.5.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run FireFox 2.0.0.2, FireFox 2.0.0.2 call another scim-launcher.
2. Ctrl+Space, call scim.
I can't input Chinese normal, I can see no select words list display.
Actual Results:  
I can't input Chinese normal, I can see no select words list display.

comments.raw_text:
This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode

comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
